pullRequest.title: Update to highlight the impact of the global state setting
pullRequest.bodyText: Updated the language and added a callout to more prominently detail what happens when including the global state of a snapshot from which indices are being restored. I've had recent cases where customers copy and pasted the second code example verbatim, updated the index and snapshot name values, and executed the command. In effect wiping out their current ILM policies, templates, and ingestion pipelines. In hindsight they realize that they were unclear of the ramifications of including the setting as is.

commit.message:
Update to highlight the impact of the global state setting

Updated the language and added a callout to more prominently detail what happens when including the global state of a snapshot from which indices are being restored. I've had recent cases where customers copy and pasted the second code example verbatim, updated the index and snapshot name values, and executed the command. In effect wiping out their current ILM policies, templates, and ingestion pipelines. In hindsight they realize that they were unclear of the ramifications of including the setting as is.

nodes.bodyText:
I really think we should use false in the example here and adjust the callout to match, with the expectation that people will continue to copy-paste this anyway.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              "include_global_state": true,              <1>
          
          
            
              "include_global_state": false,              <1>

Suggest adding include_aliases to the example too:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              "rename_replacement": "restored_index_$1"
          
          
            
              "rename_replacement": "restored_index_$1",
          
          
            
              "include_aliases": false

I think "overrides" is still a bit ambiguous. How about "overwrites"?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            cluster. This overrides current settings, templates, pipeline, and policies with
          
          
            
            cluster. This overwrites any existing cluster settings, templates, pipelines and {ilm-init} policies whose names match those in the snapshot.
